solution.text: The Kelvin-Planck statement states that no process is possible whose sole result is the absorption of heat from a reservoir and complete conversion of the heat into work.

incorrect.text: No process is possible whose sole result is the transfer of heat from a colder object to a hotter object.
No process is possible whose sole result is the transfer of work from a colder object to a hotter object.
A carnot process is possible whose sole result is the transfer of heat from a colder object to a hotter object.

correct.text: No process is possible whose sole result is the absorption of heat from a reservoir and complete conversion of the heat into work.
